intro: Trichantha elegans, commonly known as the slender thornplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Trichantha elegans typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks.
